meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>compare</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to compare</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Look at this <reading>cooler</reading> (くら). Now look at this other cooler. We need <vocabulary>to  compare</vocabulary> the two coolers. Think about all the features each one has and really compare, like you have a list or something.
